intro: Gymnogramma verticalis, commonly known as the upright gymnogramma, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are typically upright and narrow. The plant has a creeping rhizome and produces small, rounded spore cases called sorus on the underside of its leaves. Gymnogramma verticalis is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
